intro: Senecio wilsonianus, commonly known as the Wilson's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and open plains. It produces small, yellowish to white flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Senecio wilsonianus is often found in disturbed habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
